channel.title: Windows 7 on Yen's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Windows 7 on Yen's blog

item.title: Replacing motherboard without reinstalling Windows
item.description: I wanted to upgrade a couple of PCs by replacing the motherboard (by the way, when buying PC components, if there’s a Microcenter store nearby, try it first; at the time of this writing their $50 bundle discount for a motherboard-CPU combo cannot be beat, even by much-loved online enthusiast stores). Afterwards, I found that Windows 7 wouldn’t boot. In my prior experience, Windows would automatically detect the new motherboard and reconfigure itself accordingly.
